derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French déclaratif, -ive or Latin declarativus, from declarat- 'made clear', from the verb declarare (see declare)

means.word_mean: 1. a mood (grammatically unmarked) that represents the act or state as an objective fact
1. relating to the use of or having the nature of a declaration
2. relating to the mood of verbs that is used simple declarative statements;
